      • addStudent

        public Student addStudent​(java.lang.String name,
                          java.lang.String familyName)
        Adds a new student to the list of the students.
        Parameters:
        name - First name of the student to be added.
        familyName - Surname of the student to be added.
        Returns:
        If succeeded, returns the reference of the newly created student. In case of failure, returns null.

      • findStudent

        public Student findStudent​(long studentNum)
        Searches for the student that has the matching Student Number.
        Parameters:
        studentNum - Student Number of the student to be searched for the list.
        Returns:
        If succeeds, the reference of the student. If not, null

      • deleteStudent

        public Student deleteStudent​(long studentNum)
        Removes the student that has the matching student number from the list.
        Parameters:
        studentNum - Student Number of the student to be deleted from the list.
        Returns:
        If succeeds, the reference of the student. If not, null

      • addQuiz

        public boolean addQuiz​(long studentId,
                       double scale,
                       double studentGrade)
        adds a quiz to a student given studentId
        Parameters:
        scale - the scale of the quiz
        studenGrade - the grade student achieved
        Returns:
        true is case succeed, or false in case of failure

      • findTopStudent

        public Student findTopStudent()
        Finds the top student in this course. Calculation is very inefficient. The top student is found by doing a linear comparison of each student. Since student class does not provide average variable, or a method for average calculation, the average is calculated here. Score of each student = studentGrade / scale -> % score out of 0 - 1.0 As said earlier, this approach is very inefficient and linear. There are more efficient ways to calculate or structure the program to help with it however, for the sake of this assignment and simplicity, it will be kept as is.
        Returns:
        Returns the reference of the student that has the highest average grade in this course.

      • getAverage

        public double getAverage()
        Finds the average of the course. Just like findTopStudents() method, it is very inefficient and uses linear comparison.
        Returns:
        Average of the course in % format [(avg / studentList.size()) * 100]
